page.title: 13Cycling Proficiency
page.content: We did our cycling proficiency training in May and June 1985. On the first day our cycles were checked for safety by Mr Hogg the road safety officer. We practised our riding position and hand signals first and with the help of mothers fathers and teachers we learned other skills. We learned how to set off properly, to turn right at a stop sign to turn left at traffic lights and to slow down and stop. We had to practise emergency stops and to control our bicycles when moving slowly through cones. Those people who didn't do very well had extra practise. On Friday 14th June we had a practical test and a test on the Highway Code. We all passed with at least 90%. We had metal badges to wear and a sticker for our bikes and three weeks later a certificate of cycling proficiency.
